title: How to Clean Found Coins or Fountain Coins

steps.headline: Take coins and place them in a mesh strainer or an old metal strainer.
steps.description: Give the coins a rinse to get any of the loose dirt off.

steps.headline: Place the coins in a container with a small amount of dish soap.
steps.description: Let them soak for a few hours to overnight. This helps loosen any grime and dirt as well as cuts the grease.

steps.headline: Take the coins and place them in the mesh strainer and give them a spin until they are rinsed off.
If there is still a lot of grime repeat the soak and rinse.
Rinse the container that they soaked in.
Place 1 to 5 denture cleaners in the bowl and fill with water.
Place the coins back into the water and let them soak for a few more hours to overnight.
Finally take the coins give them another good rinse and they should be clean enough to use in a counter.

tyn: Large enough of a bowl for coins and water
text: Take coins and place them in a mesh strainer or an old metal strainer. Give the coins a rinse to get any of the loose dirt off. Place the coins in a container with a small amount of dish soap. Let them soak for a few hours to overnight. This helps loosen any grime and dirt as well as cuts the grease. Take the coins and place them in the mesh strainer and give them a spin until they are rinsed off.  If there is still a lot of grime repeat the soak and rinse.  Rinse the container that they soaked in.  Place 1 to 5 denture cleaners in the bowl and fill with water.  Place the coins back into the water and let them soak for a few more hours to overnight.  Finally take the coins give them another good rinse and they should be clean enough to use in a counter.

Give the coins a rinse to get any of the loose dirt off.
Place the coins in a container with a small amount of dish soap.
Let them soak for a few hours to overnight.
This helps loosen any grime and dirt as well as cuts the grease.
Take the coins and place them in the mesh strainer and give them a spin until they are rinsed off.
If there is still a lot of grime repeat the soak and rinse.
Rinse the container that they soaked in.
Place 1 to 5 denture cleaners in the bowl and fill with water.
Place the coins back into the water and let them soak for a few more hours to overnight.
Finally take the coins give them another good rinse and they should be clean enough to use in a counter.
